children.text: The Vietnam Data Science and Technology Institute is dedicated to meeting the growing demand for data analysts and data scientists, addressing market needs, and cultivating a skilled workforce in the field.

The training center can design a curriculum that covers the fundamental concepts, tools, and techniques of data analysis and data science. The curriculum should include a combination of theoretical knowledge and practical skills, incorporating topics such as data cleaning, exploratory data analysis, statistical modeling, machine learning, and data visualization. By offering a comprehensive and specialized curriculum, the training center can ensure that participants gain a strong foundation and relevant expertise in the field.

The training center should prioritize hands-on experiential learning to provide participants with practical experience in working with real-world datasets and industry-standard tools. By engaging participants in hands-on projects, case studies, and simulations, the training center can develop their analytical skills, problem-solving abilities, and critical thinking. This experiential approach will enable participants to apply their knowledge effectively in real-world scenarios, preparing them for the challenges they will encounter in their professional careers.

To enhance the quality of education, the training center should recruit experienced industry practitioners as instructors. These practitioners bring valuable insights, real-world expertise, and practical knowledge to the training programs. Their experience can bridge the gap between theoretical concepts and their practical applications in industry settings. Instructors can share their experiences, best practices, and real-life examples, providing participants with a deeper understanding of the field and its practical implications.

The training center should establish collaborations with industry partners, including companies and organizations that require data analysts and data scientists. These collaborations can provide opportunities for internships, where participants can gain hands-on experience, work on real-world projects, and learn directly from industry professionals. Industry collaborations also allow the training center to stay updated with the latest industry trends, ensuring that the curriculum remains aligned with industry needs and demands.

The training center should emphasize the importance of continuous learning and professional development by offering advanced courses, workshops, and seminars. These programs can cater to the evolving needs and emerging trends in the field of data analysis and data science. By providing avenues for participants to upskill and stay updated with the latest advancements, the training center can ensure that graduates remain competitive and adaptable in the job market.
Career placement services and networking opportunities

The training center should offer career placement services to assist participants in finding job opportunities and connecting with potential employers. This can involve organizing career fairs, facilitating networking events, and providing guidance on resume building and interview preparation. By building strong relationships with industry professionals and creating networking opportunities, the training center can enhance participants' chances of securing employment and help meet the demands of the job market.

By establishing Vietnam Data Science and Technology Institute that offers a comprehensive curriculum, hands-on experiential learning, industry-experienced instructors, industry collaborations, continuous learning support, and career placement services, the center can effectively satisfy the demand for skilled data analysts and data scientists. This initiative can contribute to building a competent workforce that meets the market needs and plays a vital role in driving data-driven decision-making and innovation in various industries.
A short-term training syllabus for data analysts typically focuses on providing a solid foundation in essential skills and concepts.
Understanding the role of data analysts and their impact on decision-making.
Introduction to data analysis processes and methodologies.
Exploring the types of data and their characteristics.
Techniques for cleaning and preprocessing data.
Creating meaningful visualizations to communicate insights.
Descriptive statistics: measures of central tendency, variability, and correlation.
Understanding databases and database management systems (DBMS).
Basic SQL queries for data retrieval and manipulation.
Introduction to Programming for Data Analysis
Basics of programming languages commonly used in data analysis (e.g., Python, R).
Data manipulation and analysis using programming libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy).
Effective data visualization and storytelling techniques.
Presenting findings and insights to stakeholders.
Hands-on exercises and projects to apply concepts and techniques learned.
Analyzing real-world datasets and solving data-related problems.
Collaboration and teamwork in data analysis projects.

title: Learning to conduct and publish research in international journals

children.text: Learning to conduct and publish research in international journals is a comprehensive process that requires a systematic approach and dedicated effort.

Start by building a strong foundation in research methodologies, including literature review, research design, data collection, and analysis. Familiarize yourself with the principles of academic writing and citation styles commonly used in your field. Enhance your critical thinking and analytical skills to effectively evaluate and interpret research findings.

Identify a research area of interest that aligns with your expertise and passion. Stay updated with the latest trends, advancements, and debates in the field to identify research gaps and potential research questions. Engage in discussions with mentors, peers, and experts to refine and shape your research ideas.

Conduct a comprehensive review of existing research in your chosen field. Identify the current state of knowledge, gaps, and areas for further investigation. Analyze and synthesize relevant literature to establish the context and theoretical framework for your research.

Develop a clear research plan outlining your research objectives, research questions, hypotheses (if applicable), methodology, data collection methods, and analysis techniques. Seek guidance from experienced researchers or mentors to ensure the feasibility and rigor of your research plan.

Implement your research plan by collecting data using appropriate methods and tools. Ensure the quality and reliability of your data through proper sampling, data validation, and data cleaning processes. Utilize statistical or qualitative analysis techniques depending on the nature of your research. Draw meaningful insights from the data that align with your research objectives.

Craft a well-structured research paper that adheres to the guidelines and requirements of the target journal. Pay attention to the journal's scope, formatting, and citation style. Clearly articulate your research objectives, methodology, findings, and conclusions. Seek feedback from mentors or colleagues to refine your writing and ensure clarity and coherence.

Identify suitable international journals that align with the scope and focus of your research. Consider factors such as the reputation, impact factor, target audience, and relevance to your research area. Familiarize yourself with the submission guidelines, editorial policies, and review process of each journal.

Prepare your manuscript according to the journal's guidelines and submit it for review. Be prepared for multiple rounds of review and address reviewers' comments and suggestions professionally and thoroughly. Revise your manuscript based on the feedback received and resubmit it within the specified timeline.

Upon acceptance, your research paper will be published in the international journal. Celebrate your accomplishment and share your findings with the scientific community. Consider presenting your research at conferences, workshops, or seminars to disseminate your work to a wider audience and engage in scholarly discussions.

Engage in ongoing professional development to enhance your research skills and keep up with the latest advancements in your field. Stay connected with academic communities, join research networks, and participate in collaborative projects to broaden your research horizons.

Learning to conduct and publish research in international journals requires persistence, resilience, and continuous learning. Through diligent practice, adherence to rigorous standards, and seeking guidance from experienced researchers, you can refine your skills and contribute to the global academic discourse.
The benchmark Indexes is designed in order to have the global performance of the VietNam stocks, and in each particular market (Ho chi Minh Stock Exchange, and the HaNoi Stock Exchange).
Also the VNX 300 Index will have 3 sub indices that divide the market in three groups in terms of capitalization: Large, Mid and Small capitalizations.
The design of these indices is described as following:
Universe : All shares listed on the two markets HOSE and HNX (over 700 stocks) are eligible.
Selection : The 300 largest companies in term of the capitalization are determined as it focuses on the liquid stocks (excluding stocks having less 10% of annual velocity or 50% of trading days)
The Ho Chi Minh stocks in the VNX 300 sample constitute the VNX HSX index
The Ha Noi stocks in the VNX 300 sample constitute the VNX HNX index
From the sample of the 300 constituents of VNX 300, the 50 leading stocks in terms of capitalization are selected and will represent the VNX Large 50 index.
The VNX Mid 100 index comprises the 100 next-largest capitalizations after the 50 largest stocks that make up the VNX Large 50 index.
The VNX Small 150 index is made up of the remaining 150 smallest capitalizations in the VNX 300 index.
The VNX Large & Mid 150 index is composed of the stocks belonging to the VNX Large 50 and VNX Mid 100 indexes.
The VNX Mid & Small 250 index is composed of the stocks belonging to the VNX Mid 100 and VNX Small 150 indexes.
After 10 years of trading, the VietNam stock market has now more than 700 listed stocks present in different industries and sectors.
VNX Industries indexes comprehend 10 main industries:
In addition, 1 Super sector is calculated:

Blue Chips indexes are Tradable and are created respecting all the necessary international standards in purpose to serve as the underlying instrument for the derivatives and other structured products.
Stocks are weighted according to their free float market capitalization with a maximum weight of 15% per stock.

The Blue chips VNX 50 index consists of 50 highest ranking stocks in terms of free float capitalization and daily turnover average. The index reflects the performance of the most representative stocks of the two markets HSX and HNX.
Universe : The VNX Large & Mid 150 index

Selection : These 150 stocks are ranked by the turnover average over the last 12 months and the free float adjusted capitalization. The first 50 combined ranked companies become the components of the VNX 50 index.
The Blue chips VNX 25 index consists of 25 highest ranking stocks in terms of free float capitalization and turnover of the VNX Large 50 index sample.

The VNX Top Exchange and Sector indexes consist of top 10 stocks in terms of free float capitalization and trading turnover, sectors index sample. Such as: VNX Top 10 Basic materials, VNX Top Consumer Goods, VNX Top 10 Finance, VNX Top 10 Healthcare, VNX Top10 Industrials, VNX Top 10 Utilities, VNX Top 10 Real Estate, VNX Top 10 Group Oil, VNX Top 10 Group Telecom, VNX Top 10 HSX, VNX Top 10 HNX.

Strategy indexes are developed in adapting some performant portfolio strategies in purpose to be served as underlying instrument for the derivatives and other structured products, IFRC INDEXES launches:
The Blue Chips index with Top 10 PVN group companies listed in Ho Chi Minh Stocks Exchange
VNX Top 25 ex Bank is the Tradable Index with all constituents of the VNX Top 25 index, excluding Bank sector companies
VNX Group Oil is the Capitalisation weighted Index with the listed companies of the Vietnam National Petroleum Group in the Ho Chi Minh and Hanoi Stock Exchanges
VNX Group Oil EW is the Equal weighted Index with the listed companies of the Vietnam National Petroleum Group in the Ho Chi Minh and Hanoi Stock Exchanges
NX Group Telecom is the Capitalisation weighted Index with the listed companies of the Vietnam Posts and Telecommunications Group in the Ho Chi Minh and Hanoi Stock Exchanges
VNX Group Telecom EW is the Equal weighted Index with the listed companies of the Vietnam Posts and Telecommunications Group in the Ho Chi Minh and Hanoi Stock Exchanges
VNX Group Coal & Mineral EW is the Equal weighted Index with the listed companies of the Coal and Mineral Group in the Ho Chi Minh and Hanoi Stock Exchanges
VNX Group Electricity is the Capitalisation weighted Index with the listed companies of the Vietnam Electricity Group in the Ho Chi Minh and Hanoi Stock Exchanges
VNX Group Electricity EW is the Equal weighted Index with the listed companies of the Vietnam Electricity Group in the Ho Chi Minh and Hanoi Stock Exchanges

Since 1997, the Saigon Tiep Thi Newspaper has conducted the program High Quality Vietnamese Goods. Every year, the Association of Vietnam High Quality Goods announces the list of the enterprises qualified with the title High Quality Vietnamese Goods and voted by the consumers. This campaign aims to change the consumers’ perception and their preference for imported goods in raising their trust in Vietnamese goods and services
The VNX High Quality indexes family is composed by 3 indexes:
The VNX High Quality index is a full market capitalisation index, and composed by companies selected by the Association and trading on the HSX and HNX stock market exchanges.
VNX HQ Goods Equal weighted index

This index is the equal-weight version of the VNX High Quality index. The index includes the same constituents as the capitalization weighted VNX High Quality index, but each company is allocated a fixed and equal weight of the index total at each semester rebalance.

The index comprises 10 leading High Quality Goods selected companies trading on the HSX and HNX stock market exchanges. It is designed to provide investors with tradable exposure to this particular theme. Their selection is based on the 12-month average daily value traded and the free float capitalisation. No stock has a weight of more than 15% at the rebalancing.

The VNX PVN Plus 10 index combines leadership companies of PVN group and 5 other major sector industries. The index is designed for use by local and international investors, and therefore reflects the float available to residents, and is fully UCITS III compliant.

The VNX Leaders 10 index serves as a investable benchmark to track, as a single asset class, the performance of 10 Vietnamese leaders across 10 industry sectors trading on the HSX and HNX stock exchanges
VNX Brokerage is the Benchmark Index with “Brokerage” stocks trading on the Ho chi Minh and Hanoi Stock Exchanges.
VNX Brokerage Equal Weighted is the Equal Weighted Index with “Brokerage” stocks trading on the Ho chi Minh and Hanoi Stock Exchanges
VNX Top 10 Brokerage is the Tradable Index with the Top 10 largest and most liquid stocks of the Brokerage’s listed companies in the Ho chi Minh and Hanoi Stock Exchanges.
VNX Steel is the Thematic index with stocks in Steel industrial trading on the Ho Chi Minh and Ha Noi Stock Exchanges
VNX Pharmaceuticals is the Thematic index with stocks in Pharmaceuticals industrial trading on the Ho Chi Minh and Ha Noi Stock Exchanges
VNX Building Materials is the Thematic index with stocks in Building Materials industrial trading on the Ho Chi Minh and Ha Noi Stock Exchanges
VNX Building Materials ex Cement is the Theme index with all constituents of the VNX Building Materials index, excluding Cement sector companies
VNX Cements the Thematic index with stocks in Cement industrial trading on the Ho Chi Minh and Ha Noi Stock Exchanges

title: BeQ/IFRC Indexes and Portfolios free and ready for Research

children.text: CCPR/IFRC Vietnam AllShares Indexes are broken down into 3 groups: Benchmark, Size and Sector
The benchmark Indexes is designed in order to have the global performance of the VietNam stocks, and in each particular market (Ho chi Minh Stock Exchange, and the Ha Noi Stock Exchange)
The overall sample is sub-divided into equal-number sub-samples following the market capitalization order:
Quintiles: Very Small (1/5), Small (1/5), Mid (1/5), Large (1/5) and Very Large (1/5)
Large (85% of total capitalization), Mid (10%), and Small (5%)
Each primary index is then calculated in 16 versions (2 weightings x 2 variants x 4 currencies).
They are calculated daily (end of the day) from 31/12/2008. Their base value is 1,000.
In total, there are 26 primary indexes, and 416 Vietnam indexes.

For the past 35 years, investors have had two choices: passive or active portfolio investment. If they believed markets were largely efficient, they chose to invest through capitalization-weighted index funds. If they believed markets were inefficient, they picked active management.
But both approaches are inherently flawed. Both approaches have their problems:
Capitalisation weighted equity index funds tend to overweight overvalued securities and underweight undervalued ones.
Active management is not transparent, comes with high fees, and tends to underperform the benchmark over long time periods.
Smart beta strategies, such as non-price-weighted indices, offer an alternative choice.

These strategy indices retain the benefits of traditional   capitalization-weighted indices, such as broad market exposure, diversification, liquidity, transparency, and low cost access to markets. At the same time, they offer the opportunity to achieve superior performance over the cap-weighted benchmark.
IFRC presents the Smart Beta indexes family:

The VNX 25 High Dividend index consists of the 25 stocks from the VNX Large 50 Index with the highest realized dividend yield over the past 12 months. Constituents are weighted relative to their corresponding past year dividend yield, with the highest yield stocks receiving the highest weights.

The VNX 25 Low Volatility index consists of the 25 stocks from the VNX Large 50 Index with the lowest realized volatility over the past 12 months. Constituents are weighted relative to the inverse of their corresponding volatility, with the least volatile stocks receiving the highest weights.

Equal weighting gives the same weight, or importance, to each stock in an index. The smallest companies are given equal weight to the largest companies in an equal-weight index. This allows all of the companies to be considered on an even playing field.
The VNX 25 Equal Weighted has the same constituents as its VNX 25 parent index. Instead of capitalisation weighting, each stock is weighted equally.
The VNX 50 Equal Weighted has the same constituents as its VNX Large 50 parent index. Instead of capitalisation weighting, each stock is weighted equally.

Within the scope of local, regional leaders (province, city) were also eager to reform and develop policies and strategies for local economic development.

The competition is silent, drastic and effective but has not been evaluated completely. PAPI (The Vietnam Provincial Governance and Public Administration Performance Index) and PCI (Provincial Competitiveness Index) biased towards measuring policy effectiveness.
Therefore, Intelligent Financial Research & Consulting (IFRC) initiatives to create a Vietnam geographical economic index measuring the economic efficiency of provinces, cities and regions in Vietnam
The Vietnam geographical economic indexes are designed and calculated based on the data of companies listed on stock exchanges, and have its head office located in that geographic area.
The Vietnam Geographical Economic Indexes series are including :
(actually 24 biggest provinces and cities, only provinces having at least 5 listed companies are calculated)

At the national level, Vietnam is trying to improve its competitiveness and international integration. Within the scope of local, regional leaders (province, city) were also eager to reform and develop policies and strategies for local economic development. The competition is silent, drastic and effective but has not been evaluated completely.
PAPI (The Vietnam Provincial Governance and Public Administration Performance Index) and PCI (Provincial Competitiveness Index) biased towards measuring policy effectiveness.
Therefore, Intelligent Financial Research & Consulting (IFRC) initiatives to create a Vietnam geographical economic index measuring the economic efficiency of provinces, cities and regions in Vietnam
The Provincial indexes family are classified into 2 groups:
VNX Provincial Ba Ria Vung Tau
VNX Provincial Ba Ria Vung Tau EW
VNX Provincial Ho Chi Minh EW
VNX Regional BTB & DH Mien Trung
VNX Regional DB Song Cuu Long
VNX Regional TD & MN Phia Bac
VNX Regional BTB & DH Mien Trung EW

Volatility indices play a crucial role in financial markets as they provide valuable insights and assist traders and investors in various ways.
These indices, such as the VIX (CBOE Volatility Index), are important indicators of market sentiment and investor fear or uncertainty levels.
By tracking the movement of volatility indices, traders can gauge the expected degree of price fluctuations in the market, allowing them to adjust their trading strategies accordingly.
Volatility indices also help investors assess the overall risk and stability of the market, enabling them to make informed decisions regarding portfolio allocation and risk management.

During periods of market turbulence, volatility indices act as valuable tools, providing a measure of market volatility that helps traders and investors identify potential opportunities or exercise caution.
They are particularly helpful in options trading, assisting traders in determining the appropriate pricing and positioning of options contracts based on expected future volatility.
Moreover, volatility indices aid in hedging strategies, allowing market participants to protect their portfolios against adverse price movements during times of increased volatility.
Market analysts and researchers utilize volatility indices as inputs in quantitative models to assess and predict market behavior, aiding in identifying trends and developing trading strategies.

The availability of volatility indices for different asset classes allows traders to assess volatility levels specific to their preferred markets or sectors. In addition to short-term trading, volatility indices are also helpful for long-term investors, as they provide insights into market conditions and risk levels, aiding in the development of a robust investment strategy.

Overall, volatility indices contribute to market transparency, serve as essential tools for risk measurement, portfolio optimization, and understanding market dynamics, thereby enhancing overall market efficiency.
Crypto indexes serve several important purposes in the cryptocurrency market:

Crypto indexes provide a holistic view of the cryptocurrency market by tracking the performance of a broad range of cryptocurrencies or specific segments within it. They offer a snapshot of the overall market health and direction, allowing investors and traders to gauge the market’s performance at a glance.

Crypto indexes serve as benchmarks or reference points for evaluating the performance of individual cryptocurrencies or cryptocurrency portfolios. Investors can compare the performance of their holdings against a relevant crypto index to assess their investments’ relative strength or weakness.
Crypto indexes help investors and fund managers develop and implement investment strategies.
They can be used as a basis for constructing diversified portfolios, sector-specific investments, or passive investment vehicles like index funds or exchange-traded funds (ETFs).
Crypto indexes provide a way to gain exposure to the broader cryptocurrency market or specific sectors without the need for individually managing multiple cryptocurrencies.

By tracking the performance of a diversified set of cryptocurrencies, crypto indexes can help manage risk. They provide a broader perspective on the market, allowing investors to assess the overall market sentiment and make more informed decisions about portfolio allocation and risk mitigation strategies.

Crypto indexes offer valuable data for market research and analysis. Researchers and analysts can study the performance and trends of different cryptocurrency segments, observe correlations among cryptocurrencies, and identify emerging patterns and opportunities.
Crypto indexes bring a level of transparency and standardization to the cryptocurrency market.

By providing a consistent methodology for calculating and tracking performance, they establish a common framework for evaluating and comparing different cryptocurrencies. This fosters trust and confidence among investors, institutions, and regulators.

Crypto indexes contribute to the education and understanding of the cryptocurrency market. They help individuals and institutions better comprehend the dynamics of the market, learn about different cryptocurrencies, and make informed decisions based on reliable data.
Overall, crypto indexes play a vital role in the maturation and professionalization of the cryptocurrency market.

They offer a valuable toolset for investors, traders, and researchers to navigate the complexities of the market, make data-driven decisions, and monitor the performance of cryptocurrencies and the market as a whole.
Beq/IFRC calculate currency indexes for several purposes:

Currency indexes provide a comprehensive view of the performance and trends in the currency market. They allow investors, traders, and financial institutions to assess the overall strength or weakness of a particular currency relative to a basket of other currencies.

Currency indexes serve as benchmarks or reference points for evaluating the performance of individual currencies or currency portfolios. Investors can compare the performance of their currency holdings against a relevant currency index to assess their investments’ relative performance.

Currency indexes help in analyzing the strength of a currency compared to other currencies. By tracking the movements of a currency index, investors can identify currencies that are gaining strength or facing weakness, aiding in making informed decisions about currency trading or investment strategies.

Currency indexes assist in managing currency risk in international business and investment. By monitoring currency indexes, businesses can assess the potential impact of currency fluctuations on their international operations, hedging strategies, and overall risk exposure.
Currency indexes provide insights into currency market trends, enabling investors to develop effective currency trading or investment strategies.
They assist in identifying potential opportunities for currency diversification, carry trades, or hedging strategies based on the relative strength or weakness of currencies.

Currency indexes facilitate the evaluation and measurement of currency investment performance. They allow investors and fund managers to compare the performance of currency investments against a benchmark index, providing a standardized and objective measure of investment success.

Currency indexes are valuable tools for research and analysis in the field of economics, finance, and international trade. They provide data that can be used to study currency correlations, analyze macroeconomic trends, and conduct academic research related to currency markets and global financial systems.
Currency indexes are used by central banks, policymakers, and economists to monitor currency movements, assess exchange rate dynamics, and formulate monetary policies.
These indexes help policymakers gain insights into the overall currency market conditions and make informed decisions to maintain price stability and manage economic growth.

Overall, currency indexes offer a comprehensive and standardized approach to analyzing currency performance, managing risk, and making informed decisions in the currency market. They are crucial tools for investors, businesses, researchers, and policymakers in understanding and navigating the dynamics of global currencies.
The Thematic index with Top 50 listed companies ranked following Forbes methodology.
VLI indexes are one of the most performing indexes in the Vietnam Stock Markets, they include:
PVN-Index family is one of measurement scales reflecting the business performance of PetroVietnam.

PVN-Index family, particularly in the financial market, will better support effective capital mobilization channels for PVN and affiliates, when PVN is strengthening capital raising activities on domestic and international markets.
The index will enhance the transparency in business activities, management and information releasing of PVN and affiliates.
Through taking part in the index, companies will be required to publish specific information about financial situations and business activities.

The publishing of this information on the website of PVN-Index in two languages, Vietnamese-English, and on prestigious financial channels like Bloomberg will create an efficient information provision environment for domestic and international investors, and enhance the transparency.

PVN-Index family contains a wide range of index types, including tradable index (PVN-10). This is a preparation step for investing in index products – an indispensable trend for the Vietnamese stock market in the near future.
The development following international standards will help PVN-10 to easily become a trading product with investors when SSC allows the trading of new investment vehicles.
Financial instruments on tradable index are expected to be an efficient capital mobilization channel with PVN and its affiliates.
The index family is developed satisfying international standards, and expected to be acknowledged by international investor society.
The index family is developed following international standards to be highly representative and commercialized in international financial market, in particular:
Each index is calculated as both Price Return Index and Total Return Index.
PVN-Index is calculated both at End of Day and in Real Time
The index is calculated and converted to popular currencies to attract the interest of international investors. The foreign currencies used are USD, EUR, and JPY.
Stock selection in calculating index has to satisfy some requirements based on market capitalization and liquidity.
PVN-Index uses the international industry classification license of ICBs (Industry Classification Benchmarks) from FTSE International Limited (UK) for companies in the index.
The information of the index is published on Bloomberg with specific access code, and displayed in real- time as an equity index.
This procedure bring back efficiency for international professional investor in tracking index movement

On behalf of BeQ Holdings, I would like to extend my heartfelt gratitude to Mr. Harry, a global thought leader with extensive experience in driving transformative innovations in Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, and Capital Structuring.

We are honored by his visit to Vietnam and by the signing of a strategic partnership agreement with BeQ Holdings. This marks not only a significant milestone for us, but also the beginning of a powerful collaboration to deliver global breakthrough solutions, with a special focus on the European and Vietnamese markets.

As the Chairman of the Luxembourg Blockchain Association, Mr. Harry brings with him unparalleled expertise and invaluable connections that will open doors for professional investors and global financial institutions to engage with Vietnam—elevating the country’s position as a regional hub for financial and technological innovation.

We firmly believe that, based on our shared values of sustainability, transparency, and innovation, this collaboration will foster strong growth for both sides and create long-lasting impact for the business community and society at large.
Once again, thank you Mr. Harry for your trust and partnership.

title: BeQ Holdings Celebrates Unique Financial Strategies in Week 4

children.text: has just concluded an impressive Week 4 competition with the theme “14-Day Plan for the First Profitable Financial Product.” This 14-day plan aims to develop and launch the first financial product, with the goal of achieving a minimum net revenue of USD 50,000 per month within 90 days of launch. Competing teams showcased innovative ideas and well-defined strategies, presenting unique investment solutions to meet the diverse demands of today’s financial market.
is proud to recognize and honor the efforts of each team and the groundbreaking investment products introduced this week.

Led by Mr. Minh, the Diya team won first prize with their investment strategy, Review Strategy, focused on major indices such as the S&P 500 and NIKKEI 225. This strategy identifies potential companies likely to join these indices in the future, allowing for strategic buy-in before and sell-off after the announcement date. This approach enables the Diya team to achieve an average monthly return of 7.91%, with a commitment to significantly grow initial capital through a long-term investment formula.
Mentor: Ms. Ta Thi My Phuong

Under the guidance of Ms. Ta Thi My Phuong, the Bright Champion team developed a Copy Trading platform that allows users to replicate strategies from financial experts. The product is designed to serve customers looking for stable additional income, especially investors with low-risk tolerance. The team’s financial strategy includes management fees and profits from trading activities, aiming for a monthly net profit of USD 50,000 with a projected 15% monthly return from this automated trading platform.

Led by Mr. Huy Thanh, Elite Squad introduced a comprehensive automated trading tool, Bot Trading and VIX, designed to eliminate emotional influence from trading and optimize profit margins. The product targets individuals and businesses with stable incomes seeking sustainable financial investments. With a 14-day launch plan, the team aims for monthly returns of 2.4% and an annual return of 30%, with an expected net revenue of USD 50,000 per month within 90 days post-launch.

, a financial expert and member of the judging panel, expressed her sincere appreciation for the teams’ enthusiasm and effort. She emphasized that, besides product development, teams should focus more on customer acquisition strategies and building customer loyalty to maximize revenue. According to her, success depends not only on product quality but also on the ability to convey value to customers, helping them understand and feel ready to use the product.

title: Weekly Recap – In-Depth Analysis of the Global and Vietnamese Financial Markets

children.text: The U.S. Economy and Its Impact on U.S. Financial Markets

Over the past week, the U.S. economy showed signs of stabilization, though some indicators pointed to a slowdown. The July jobs report revealed only 187,000 new jobs, falling short of expectations, while the unemployment rate remained steady at 3.5%. This stability may prompt the Federal Reserve to reconsider further interest rate hikes, potentially pressuring emerging markets reliant on USD-denominated debt.

European stock markets experienced a relatively stable week, with the Stoxx 600 index rising by 0.5%. However, high inflation and political uncertainty remain significant risks. The Bank of England may need to raise interest rates to control inflation, which could negatively impact investment flows into the stock market in the short term.

Asian stock markets saw a slight recovery, with Japan’s Nikkei 225 rising by 1.1% and Hong Kong’s Hang Seng increasing by 0.8%. Economic stimulus packages from China are aiding market recovery, though concerns about a slowdown in the Chinese economy remain a critical issue.

The past week highlighted the stability and attractiveness of the Vietnamese financial market. The VN-Index has risen by approximately 10% since the beginning of the year, with expected earnings growth of 19% for 2024. Domestic retail investors dominated, accounting for 90% of daily trading volume despite foreign investor withdrawals. On the macroeconomic front, Vietnam’s GDP is projected to grow between 6% and 6.5% in 2024. FDI inflows reached nearly $15.2 billion in the first half of 2024, a 13.1% increase year-over-year, significantly contributing to economic growth.

Emerging markets are facing challenges due to a stronger USD and rising borrowing costs. However, markets like India and Indonesia remain resilient, supported by domestic economic policies and FDI inflows.

If the August CPI report shows a significant decline in inflation: The Federal Reserve may decide to pause interest rate hikes. This could lead to a stock market recovery, particularly in growth-oriented sectors like technology and non-essential consumer goods, which are highly sensitive to interest rates. Historically, lower inflation rates have bolstered investor confidence, driving stock prices higher. For example, after the October 2022 CPI report indicated slower inflation growth, the S&P 500 surged by 5.5% in a single day, the largest gain in two years.

If inflation remains persistently high: The Fed may feel compelled to continue aggressive monetary tightening, potentially raising interest rates by another 25 basis points. This could further strengthen the USD, making debt repayment more costly for emerging markets. A strong dollar would also pressure U.S. exports by making American goods more expensive abroad, potentially slowing corporate earnings growth. In such a scenario, defensive sectors like utilities and essential consumer goods may outperform as investors seek safer havens.

If the ECB signals further interest rate hikes: European markets may experience increased volatility. Higher interest rates could dampen economic growth prospects, particularly in highly leveraged economies like Italy and Spain, where debt servicing costs would rise. European bond markets could also face a sell-off, leading to higher yields and making corporate borrowing more expensive. Conversely, the Euro could strengthen against the USD, slightly easing inflation pressures but potentially harming the region’s export competitiveness.

If the ECB pauses interest rate hikes: European stocks could see a short-term recovery, particularly in interest-rate-sensitive sectors like real estate and finance. However, this could also keep inflation expectations elevated, potentially leading to long-term economic instability if inflation remains uncontrolled. The ECB’s challenge is to balance inflation control with economic growth, a delicate task given the diverse economic conditions across member states.

If China releases strong economic data: Positive data, such as robust industrial production or retail sales, could boost investor confidence across Asia, leading to a recovery in regional markets. China’s government stimulus measures, such as infrastructure spending or consumer subsidies, could have spillover effects, benefiting economies closely linked to China through trade, such as South Korea and Australia.

If China’s economic data disappoints: Weak data could exacerbate concerns about a prolonged economic slowdown, leading to sell-offs in Asian markets. Given China’s critical role in global supply chains, such a downturn could impact global manufacturing and trade. This could particularly harm export-driven economies like Japan and Taiwan, while also pushing global commodity prices lower, affecting markets from Australia to Brazil.

If FDI inflows continue to grow: We could see sustained strength in the VN-Index, particularly in sectors like real estate, industry, and technology. Vietnam’s growing role in global manufacturing, as companies diversify away from China, supports a positive long-term outlook. Should FDI exceed expectations, it could lead to accelerated economic growth, potentially pushing GDP growth above the 6.5% mark for 2024.

If global conditions worsen (e.g., higher U.S. interest rates, stronger USD): Vietnam may face challenges such as capital outflows and rising borrowing costs. This could pressure the Vietnamese Dong and lead to higher inflation, potentially forcing the State Bank of Vietnam to tighten monetary policy. A tighter monetary environment could slow growth in key sectors, particularly real estate and consumer spending, which are highly sensitive to interest rates.

If the USD continues to strengthen: Emerging markets may face capital outflows as investors seek safety in U.S. assets. This could lead to currency depreciation and higher inflation in these economies, forcing central banks to raise interest rates, which could dampen economic growth. Countries with significant foreign debt, such as Turkey and Argentina, may be particularly vulnerable to a strong USD.

If the USD stabilizes or weakens: Emerging markets could see a resurgence of capital inflows, benefiting from a more favorable exchange rate environment. This could ease inflation pressures and allow central banks more room to focus on growth rather than inflation control. Markets like India and Brazil, with strong domestic growth narratives, could particularly benefit.

Job Title: Data Scientist for Research Platform
Strong command of the English language in reading, speaking, and writing.
with over 2 years of proven experience.

As a Data Scientist for the Research Platform, you will be an integral part of a team responsible for leveraging data science techniques and methodologies to enhance the capabilities of our research platform. Your expertise in data analysis, machine learning, and statistical modeling will be crucial in extracting valuable insights from complex data sets, improving data quality, and developing innovative tools to support research efforts across various domains.

1. Data Analysis and Exploration: Conduct exploratory data analysis on diverse datasets to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies. Collaborate with researchers and domain experts to understand data requirements and uncover potential research opportunities.

2. Machine Learning Model Development: Design, develop, and implement machine learning models to support predictive analytics, classification, clustering, and other research-driven tasks. Utilize both supervised and unsupervised learning techniques to extract meaningful information from data.

3. Data Cleaning and Preprocessing: Preprocess and clean raw data to ensure data quality and consistency. Address missing data, handle outliers, and apply appropriate data transformation techniques to prepare data for analysis.

4. Feature Engineering: Identify and engineer relevant features from raw data to improve the performance of machine learning models. Leverage domain knowledge to create meaningful and informative features for specific research needs.

5. Research Tool Development: Build data analysis tools, algorithms, and pipelines that streamline research workflows and enable researchers to efficiently analyze and interpret data. Focus on creating scalable and reusable solutions.

6. Performance Evaluation: Develop methodologies for evaluating the performance of machine learning models and research tools. Conduct rigorous testing and validation to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the outputs.

7. Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate with researchers, data engineers, and other stakeholders to understand their needs and provide data science expertise. Communicate findings and results effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.

8. Data Visualization: Create informative and visually appealing data visualizations to present research findings, trends, and insights. Use interactive visualizations to facilitate data exploration by researchers.

9. Continuous Learning: Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, and related fields. Explore and implement cutting-edge methodologies and techniques to improve the research platform.

10. Data Privacy and Security: Ensure compliance with data privacy and security regulations when handling sensitive or confidential data. Implement measures to protect data integrity and confidentiality.
1. Master’s or Ph.D. in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
2. Strong background in data analysis, machine learning, and statistical modeling.
3. Proficiency in programming languages such as
, or similar, and experience with data manipulation and machine learning libraries.
4. Experience in handling and analyzing large-scale and complex datasets.
5. Familiarity with research platforms, data repositories, and data integration processes.
6. Knowledge of data visualization techniques and tools to communicate complex findings effectively.
7. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to derive meaningful insights from diverse data sources.
8. Excellent communication and teamwork skills to collaborate effectively with interdisciplinary teams.
9. Experience with cloud computing platforms and distributed computing is a plus.
10. Knowledge of research methodologies and practices across various domains is advantageous.
Job Title: Data Scientist for Indexing
Strong command of the English language in reading, speaking, and writing.
with over 2 years of proven experience.
As a Data Scientist for Indexing, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and optimizing financial indexes used in investment products and services.

Your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and programming will be essential in creating accurate and reliable benchmarks for evaluating investment performance and guiding portfolio management decisions.

Collaborate with the research and investment teams to understand the objectives and requirements for creating new financial indexes. Design innovative index methodologies that accurately represent the underlying market or asset class.
Source and collect financial data from various internal and external sources. Cleanse and preprocess the data to ensure its quality and suitability for index calculations.

Apply advanced statistical techniques and quantitative methods to analyze financial data and identify patterns and trends relevant to index construction. Develop mathematical models for index calculation, considering factors such as weighting schemes and rebalancing procedures.

Continuously explore ways to improve index performance and efficiency. Utilize statistical analysis and optimization techniques to enhance the risk-return profile and representativeness of the indexes.

Conduct rigorous backtesting and validation of index methodologies using historical data to ensure their robustness and accuracy. Analyze the performance of the indexes and compare them against relevant benchmarks.
Create clear and insightful data visualizations to communicate index characteristics, historical performance, and other relevant information to internal stakeholders and clients.
Develop tools and scripts to automate data processing, index calculations, and reporting tasks. Enhance the efficiency of index development and maintenance processes.

Work closely with cross-functional teams, including portfolio managers, research analysts, and IT professionals, to ensure seamless integration of indexes into investment strategies and products. Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and understandable manner.
Stay updated with industry regulations and best practices related to index construction and maintenance. Ensure that the indexes meet all necessary regulatory requirements.
Stay abreast of the latest developments in data science, machine learning, and financial markets. Identify and implement innovative approaches to improve index construction and analysis.
1. Master’s or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Finance, or a related field.
2. Strong background in statistical analysis, quantitative research, and data modeling.
3. Proficiency in programming languages such as
, or similar, and experience with data manipulation libraries and tools.
4. Familiarity with financial markets, investment products, and asset classes.
5. Experience working with financial data sets and understanding of data challenges specific to financial markets.
6. Knowledge of index methodologies, including market-cap weighting, price return, total return, and rebalancing.
7. Ability to develop and implement complex mathematical models for index calculation and optimization.
8. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.
9. Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively within a team environment.
10. Experience with data visualization tools and techniques.
11. Knowledge of regulatory requirements related to financial indexes is a plus.

title: Learning to conduct and publish research in international journals

children.text: Learning to conduct and publish research in international journals is a comprehensive process that requires a systematic approach and dedicated effort.

Start by building a strong foundation in research methodologies, including literature review, research design, data collection, and analysis. Familiarize yourself with the principles of academic writing and citation styles commonly used in your field. Enhance your critical thinking and analytical skills to effectively evaluate and interpret research findings.

Identify a research area of interest that aligns with your expertise and passion. Stay updated with the latest trends, advancements, and debates in the field to identify research gaps and potential research questions. Engage in discussions with mentors, peers, and experts to refine and shape your research ideas.

Conduct a comprehensive review of existing research in your chosen field. Identify the current state of knowledge, gaps, and areas for further investigation. Analyze and synthesize relevant literature to establish the context and theoretical framework for your research.

Develop a clear research plan outlining your research objectives, research questions, hypotheses (if applicable), methodology, data collection methods, and analysis techniques. Seek guidance from experienced researchers or mentors to ensure the feasibility and rigor of your research plan.

Implement your research plan by collecting data using appropriate methods and tools. Ensure the quality and reliability of your data through proper sampling, data validation, and data cleaning processes. Utilize statistical or qualitative analysis techniques depending on the nature of your research. Draw meaningful insights from the data that align with your research objectives.

Craft a well-structured research paper that adheres to the guidelines and requirements of the target journal. Pay attention to the journal's scope, formatting, and citation style. Clearly articulate your research objectives, methodology, findings, and conclusions. Seek feedback from mentors or colleagues to refine your writing and ensure clarity and coherence.

Identify suitable international journals that align with the scope and focus of your research. Consider factors such as the reputation, impact factor, target audience, and relevance to your research area. Familiarize yourself with the submission guidelines, editorial policies, and review process of each journal.

Prepare your manuscript according to the journal's guidelines and submit it for review. Be prepared for multiple rounds of review and address reviewers' comments and suggestions professionally and thoroughly. Revise your manuscript based on the feedback received and resubmit it within the specified timeline.

Upon acceptance, your research paper will be published in the international journal. Celebrate your accomplishment and share your findings with the scientific community. Consider presenting your research at conferences, workshops, or seminars to disseminate your work to a wider audience and engage in scholarly discussions.

Engage in ongoing professional development to enhance your research skills and keep up with the latest advancements in your field. Stay connected with academic communities, join research networks, and participate in collaborative projects to broaden your research horizons.

Learning to conduct and publish research in international journals requires persistence, resilience, and continuous learning. Through diligent practice, adherence to rigorous standards, and seeking guidance from experienced researchers, you can refine your skills and contribute to the global academic discourse.
A medium-term training syllabus for data scientists typically goes beyond the foundational concepts covered in short-term training and delves deeper into advanced techniques and methodologies.
While the specific syllabus may vary based on the training provider and objectives, here is a general outline of topics that can be covered in a medium-term data scientist training program:
• Advanced data cleaning and preprocessing techniques.
• Dealing with high-dimensional and unstructured data.
• Advanced statistical concepts and inference methods.
• Analysis of variance (ANOVA) and experimental design.
• Supervised learning algorithms (e.g., linear regression, decision trees, random forests, gradient boosting).
• Unsupervised learning algorithms (e.g., clustering, dimensionality reduction).
• Evaluation metrics and model selection techniques.
• Neural network architectures (e.g., feedforward, convolutional, recurrent).
• Transfer learning and fine-tuning pre-trained models.
Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Text Mining
• Techniques for processing and analyzing text data.
• Sentiment analysis, text classification, and named entity recognition.
• Introduction to distributed computing and big data frameworks.
• Model monitoring and performance evaluation in production environments.
• Undertaking a comprehensive data science project from start to finish.
• Working with real-world datasets and industry-specific challenges.
• Presenting the project findings and insights to stakeholders.

The Vietnam Data Science and Technology Institute is dedicated to meeting the growing demand for data analysts and data scientists, addressing market needs, and cultivating a skilled workforce in the field.

The training center can design a curriculum that covers the fundamental concepts, tools, and techniques of data analysis and data science. The curriculum should include a combination of theoretical knowledge and practical skills, incorporating topics such as data cleaning, exploratory data analysis, statistical modeling, machine learning, and data visualization. By offering a comprehensive and specialized curriculum, the training center can ensure that participants gain a strong foundation and relevant expertise in the field.

The training center should prioritize hands-on experiential learning to provide participants with practical experience in working with real-world datasets and industry-standard tools. By engaging participants in hands-on projects, case studies, and simulations, the training center can develop their analytical skills, problem-solving abilities, and critical thinking. This experiential approach will enable participants to apply their knowledge effectively in real-world scenarios, preparing them for the challenges they will encounter in their professional careers.

To enhance the quality of education, the training center should recruit experienced industry practitioners as instructors. These practitioners bring valuable insights, real-world expertise, and practical knowledge to the training programs. Their experience can bridge the gap between theoretical concepts and their practical applications in industry settings. Instructors can share their experiences, best practices, and real-life examples, providing participants with a deeper understanding of the field and its practical implications.

The training center should establish collaborations with industry partners, including companies and organizations that require data analysts and data scientists. These collaborations can provide opportunities for internships, where participants can gain hands-on experience, work on real-world projects, and learn directly from industry professionals. Industry collaborations also allow the training center to stay updated with the latest industry trends, ensuring that the curriculum remains aligned with industry needs and demands.

The training center should emphasize the importance of continuous learning and professional development by offering advanced courses, workshops, and seminars. These programs can cater to the evolving needs and emerging trends in the field of data analysis and data science. By providing avenues for participants to upskill and stay updated with the latest advancements, the training center can ensure that graduates remain competitive and adaptable in the job market.
Career placement services and networking opportunities

The training center should offer career placement services to assist participants in finding job opportunities and connecting with potential employers. This can involve organizing career fairs, facilitating networking events, and providing guidance on resume building and interview preparation. By building strong relationships with industry professionals and creating networking opportunities, the training center can enhance participants' chances of securing employment and help meet the demands of the job market.

By establishing Vietnam Data Science and Technology Institute that offers a comprehensive curriculum, hands-on experiential learning, industry-experienced instructors, industry collaborations, continuous learning support, and career placement services, the center can effectively satisfy the demand for skilled data analysts and data scientists. This initiative can contribute to building a competent workforce that meets the market needs and plays a vital role in driving data-driven decision-making and innovation in various industries.

As a Data Analyst Trainee, you will be part of a dynamic team responsible for analyzing and interpreting large volumes of data to extract valuable insights. You will work closely with senior data analysts and stakeholders to support data-driven decision-making and contribute to the organization’s overall data strategy.
This role offers an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data analysis techniques, tools, and processes.
Assist in collecting, cleaning, and organizing large datasets from various sources, ensuring data quality and integrity.
Utilize statistical methods and data visualization tools to analyze data, identify trends, patterns, and correlations, and present findings in a clear and concise manner.
Generate reports, dashboards, and presentations summarizing data analysis results to facilitate decision-making and provide insights to stakeholders.
Perform data validation and quality checks to ensure accuracy, consistency, and completeness of data sets.
Collaborate with team members on data-related projects, contributing ideas and insights to drive continuous improvement in data analysis processes and methodologies.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends, techniques, and tools related to data analysis and apply them effectively in your work.
Adhere to data privacy and security policies to maintain the confidentiality and integrity of sensitive information.
Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, translating complex data analysis concepts into easily understandable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Participate in training programs and professional development activities to enhance your skills and knowledge in data analysis.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to manipulate and analyze complex data sets.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, or statistical software (e.g., R, Python, or SAS).
Knowledge of data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or D3.js is a plus.
Familiarity with basic statistical concepts and techniques.
Excellent attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets.
Strong communication and presentation skills to effectively convey insights to stakeholders.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and adapt to changing priorities.
Eagerness to learn and develop skills in data analysis and related technologies.

title: Research Project: Market High Volatility, Risk or Opportunities

children.text: Market high volatility can bring both risks and opportunities for traders and investors.
The increased uncertainty that accompanies high volatility can make it challenging to accurately predict and time trades, posing a risk of potential losses.
Additionally, the rapid price fluctuations can evoke emotional responses and lead to impulsive trading decisions, further magnifying losses.
Liquidity concerns may also arise, with wider bid-ask spreads and lower trading volumes affecting order execution.
However, market high volatility also presents opportunities.
Traders can capitalize on significant price movements to potentially generate profits through short-term trading strategies like scalping or swing trading.
The increased trading volumes and liquidity in volatile markets can improve order execution and minimize slippage, benefiting active traders.
Moreover, price discrepancies and mispricing may occur during market volatility, allowing traders to exploit inefficiencies for profit.
For long-term investors, market volatility can offer attractive entry points for quality assets that become undervalued due to significant declines in prices.
Such opportunities can be beneficial for portfolio diversification and long-term investment strategies.
It is important to approach market volatility with a careful analysis, employing risk management techniques, and having a thorough understanding of one’s trading or investment strategy.
By evaluating risk tolerance and implementing appropriate risk mitigation measures, traders and investors can navigate the potential downsides and seek to benefit from market high volatility.
The establishment of an ASEAN Monetary Unit (AMU) could potentially bring several benefits and importance to the ASEAN (Association of Southeast Asian Nations) region.
Here are some ways in which an AMU could be useful:

: A common monetary unit can simplify trade transactions within the ASEAN region by eliminating currency exchange costs and reducing currency volatility risks. It would create a more seamless and efficient economic environment, promoting increased trade and investment among ASEAN member countries.

: An AMU could contribute to regional stability by promoting economic cooperation and reducing currency fluctuations. A stable regional currency can provide a more predictable economic environment, attracting foreign investments and fostering economic growth.

: A common monetary unit can make travel within the ASEAN region easier and more convenient for tourists and business travelers. It eliminates the need for currency exchange and allows for easy price comparisons, leading to increased tourism and business activities.

: An AMU could foster the development of deeper and more integrated financial markets within ASEAN. It would encourage cross-border investments and enhance the liquidity and depth of financial instruments. This, in turn, would attract more foreign investments and support the growth of the regional financial sector.

: A common monetary unit would require closer coordination of monetary policies among ASEAN member countries. This coordination can lead to more harmonized monetary policies, exchange rate stability, and effective management of inflation and economic cycles within the region.

: A unified ASEAN monetary unit could strengthen the collective economic influence of ASEAN on the global stage. It would enhance the region’s bargaining power in international trade negotiations, improve its ability to address regional economic challenges, and potentially promote the use of the AMU as a reserve currency.
However, it is important to note that establishing an AMU would require significant coordination, consensus, and preparation among ASEAN member countries.
It involves addressing issues such as monetary policy convergence, fiscal discipline, and harmonization of financial regulations.
Additionally, countries would need to carefully consider the potential costs and benefits, as well as the impact on their national sovereignty and monetary autonomy.

title: Research Project : Vietnam AI Development Index

children.text: Prime Minister has unveiled Vietnam’s ambitious artificial intelligence masterplan up until 2030: Vietnam’s 2030 targets will take it into ASEAN’s top four:

following the Oxford AI country Readiness index, Vietnam is currently ranked in 76th position in the World, 6th in ASEAN with 42.944 pts behind Singapore (6th, 78.704), Malaysia (28th, 62.434), Thailand (60th, 48.156), Indonesia (62nd, 47, 528), Philippines (74th, 42.944)
and the world’s top 50 countries in terms of AI research, development, and application.
The government wants Vietnam to establish 10 reputable AI brands or services by 2030 and plans to build 3 national big data storage centers to give businesses access to high-performance computing.
Vietnam is still lagging behind many countries, are these objectives realistic?

If we are to assess the situation today, to know the strengths and weaknesses and to reinforce or improve them, we need to have metrics, calculated periodically, allowing us to compare with other countries and to monitor progress, and to know the remaining path to achieve these goals.
There are a few indexes on Artificial Intelligence, based mainly on the results of surveys and published annually.
Vietnam is present, and relatively poorly ranked in some of them:

These indexes shed light on certain particular points such as the role/strategy of government, the adoption of IA, or the labor market, but there is not yet a more global index combining these factors.

It would be interesting to have a family of indexes quantifying the motivation of the government and its measures put in place, the adoption by the general public, and enterprises, and the impacts and the results on the labor market, and the benefits on cost, revenue, productivity and efficiency.
COVID-19 is also a boosting factor of AI, especially for Manufacturing, Commerce, Medical, Education, Finance.
Criteria could be classified into pillars (non-exhaustive list):
Government/Regulation: Vision, Governance & Ethics, Digital Capacity, Adaptability, AI Risks and Penalties (see EU regulations)
Data and Infrastructure: Infrastructure(Cost, Performance, …), Data availability (History, Volume, …), Data Representativeness
Demographic/Economic: Population/Youth, Internet/Mobile Users, Labor, Diversity, …
Size (investments, projects value, market capitalisation listed companies),
Job Marketplace (Offer/Demande, Salary average vs other IT),
Competition between domestic vs foreign AI companies located in Vietnam (attractive salary, working conditions, …)
Business Profitability: Listed companies prices returns/performance like IFRC Global AI indexes …
Survey: Adoption/Transformation/Impacts in industry, enterprise (see study by McKinsey), population/everyday life, COVID-19, …
Occurence keywords in social networks, online newspapers, ….
Benefits, Impacts and Results of AI Statistics
The quality of the indexes obviously depends on the input data.
These data and statistics can be obtained from free, public, or paid sources. Like the other existing indexes, the results of surveys will also be essential.

The construction of the index (and sub-indexes) must be transparent, replicable for any country, region, city or sector. It will be a weighted average (equal, different, or optimized after research) of the ratings of the various criteria. These criteria are quantified, rebased between 0 and 100.

They will make it possible to evaluate the strong points and the weak points, to reinforce strong points, and to improve weak points. These input/output data and indicators can then be integrated into explanatory/forecasting models for international scientific publications.
The Web and Brochure Designer Trainee is an entry-level position that offers hands-on training and experience in web design and brochure design.
The trainee will work under the guidance of experienced designers and learn various aspects of designing websites and creating attractive brochures.
This position is ideal for individuals looking to start a career in the design field and gain practical knowledge and skills.
Assisting in the creation of visually appealing and user-friendly websites using HTML, CSS, and other web design technologies.
Collaborating with the design team to develop wireframes, mockups, and prototypes for web and brochure projects.
Learning and implementing design principles, such as color theory, typography, and layout, to create visually appealing designs.
Assisting in the creation and editing of brochure content, ensuring it is engaging, informative, and aligned with the brand’s identity.
Collaborating with the marketing team to understand project requirements and objectives for web and brochure designs.
Conducting research on industry trends and competitor designs to ensure the created designs are modern and visually appealing.
Assisting in the optimization of web designs for different devices and screen sizes, ensuring a responsive user experience.
Learning and implementing best practices for SEO (Search Engine Optimization) to enhance website visibility and performance.
Assisting in the maintenance and updates of existing websites and brochures, ensuring they remain current and accurate.
Participating in design review sessions and actively seeking feedback from senior designers to improve design skills.
Proficiency in design software such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or similar tools.
Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, and web design principles is desirable.
Strong creative and artistic skills, with an eye for detail and a passion for creating visually appealing designs.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with team members.
Self-motivated and eager to learn new design techniques and technologies.
Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
A portfolio of previous design work or relevant projects is a plus.

As the Web and Brochure Designer Trainee gains experience and improves their skills, they can progress to more advanced roles within BeQ Holdings Media Team and Projects such as the Women CEO World Magazine (

Strong presentation skills and communication skills
capable of working well with colleagues across the business.
Confidence taking responsibility for all kinds of tasks, processes and projects.

Master’s degree in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics

Look to utilize and enhance optimization techniques to support product innovation and implementations of custom index optimization techniques, tax-managed strategies and risk-controlled or defined-outcome index solutions

Understand BeQ Holdings’s position within the competitive index universe and deliver an articulate message that highlights the firm’s investment process, technologies, and investment talent versus other major providers.
Sharpen messaging, marketing materials and other content that supports existing and new business initiatives.

Communicate confidently with external audiences about performance, portfolio construction techniques, portfolio management tools and technology, index rebalances and trading results, and other implementation considerations on behalf of the portfolio management teams.
Attend index committee meetings, industry conferences, and generally stay abreast of latest market activity and industry best practices.
Conduct systematic research and work with our ESG teams to integrate insights into portfolio where applicable.
Systematize and automate processes where appropriate
